page.title: 03SAGAS OF MOUNT CABURN
page.content:
A contest on Mount Caburn and how the hill fort was saved for posterity Hurrah!
Some women in{Glynde}wanted to make a {balaclava}for Caburn because they thought he'd be cold. But a man stopped them. He said, "There are plenty of hills in{Brighton.}You could earn your living knitting{balaclavas } for hills in Brighton." So Caburn will stay a grassy hill forever!
The{giant}John Caburn got ready for the start of the{ice cream}race. He had a{gooseberry}flavoured ice cream. "Go" shouted the starter. The giants started. Then,{SPLAT!}The{gooseberry {icecream}fell on the floor. They tried to move it. Next day it became Mount Caburn.
